questions.question: A French doughnut-like pastry is called “pets de nonne,” meaning…?
Night-shift policemen in the 1950s started the doughnut-loving stereotype because...?

choices.answer: Doughnut shops were one of the few places open that late
Police officers just really love doughnuts
They needed the sugar to stay awake
They were treating themselves for dealing with stupid people

questions.question: "Doughnut" is the original spelling, but how did "donut" become popular?

choices.answer: Dunkin' Donuts spells it that way
Various advertisers wanted to save space
People had to use fewer characters in texting's early days
